distribution_native_art_desc: Acampe taiwaniana is primarily native to Taiwan. It is commonly found in the mountainous regions of the island, particularly in the central and eastern areas. This plant thrives in humid, shaded environments, often growing in forests or on rocky slopes. It is an endemic species, meaning it is not found naturally anywhere else in the world. Its distribution is limited to specific habitats within Taiwan, making it a unique part of the region's biodiversity.
distribution_introduced_art_desc: Acampe taiwaniana was mainly introduced to the eastern coastal regions of Taiwan, where it thrives in moist, shaded environments. It has been observed growing in forest understories and along stream banks, often in areas with high humidity.
